content:
It looked like it should have been very easy.
It was very difficult.
I reached a 25% solution in 15 minutes. (I who have done probably 1,000 clashes). All of the other 5 participants, one of them level 27, had 0%.
I don't have time to analyze it and tell you why it's too hard, so I won't downvote. But I will tell you it appears to be too hard.

To downvoters:
I always speak about the flaws of a puzzle when I downvote one. I'd like you to do the same so I can see where I did wrong

I don't get the point of this introduction: "Welcome back, [...] Super, tell you what!" Is there a reason for it, or is it just useless?

Would be nice if the title of the exercise would contain 'Mountain'.
I was thinking of 'Mountain Code' thinking of 'Mountain Goat' but I admit it's not great... maybe someone else finds something better ;-)

Otherwise, I like the idea

You should change the constraints for N to maybe to 0 < N <= 100 or exclude the test case for N = 10 because otherwise one can write something like this: 
*link deleted*
ASCII art!! love it. I solved it in Java but its long af xD

I've also updated the title and the statement to make it a bit more spicy. Hope you like it
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/378639719728152587/530119729625563167/unknown.png

Changed the constraints accordingly but it's impossible to change the test cases to high numbers such as 100 because of the character limit of CG's output field. Also, please delete your link if this contribution gets accepted

Initial name of it was just "Mountain" but I thought it was too bland so I decided to spice it up with some Bob Ross references such as:

The Joy of Painting->The Joy of Printing
Welcome back, [...] Super, tell you what!->Every episode of that show starts with that sentence

Is the name The Joy of Printing Mountains too long? I'll also shorten the introduction, no worries
You did wrong by proposing ASCII Art, very few people like that kind ;)
A little variety won't kill anyone :D Most of the puzzles I make are math heavy anyway

Ok, sorry for not knowing Bob Ross' 'The joy of painting' show. Now, both the title and introduction make sense. I just looked it up and saw a picture of 'Bob Ross' drawing mountains!
Had a quick look at the 'Majestic Mountains' youtube video and even an article called 'AI Bot Writes an Episode of Bob Rossâ€™ The Joy of Painting'!

Maybe add somewhere that the goal is to code a 'Bob Ross bot' :-)
You are right about the title tho. Also, not everyone has to know about Bob Ross, I'll keep the references at minimum
I've updated the statement and the title. How does it look now?

I don't know what to say, cause I also like the fact that puzzles and CoC's make me discover stuff that I did not know about (be it technical or not). Therefore, I now find it a pity that the Bob Ross reference is gone. Let's see what others say.

Well, most of the references are still there, such as The Joy of Printing and a few most-known lines of Bob Ross. Title also now contains the word "mountain" and a Bob Ross reference at the same time. I think this is quite a good middle-ground
Btw, only the validators has a test case where N=10, it's not visible to the clashers, no worries there
Nice o(1) solution. I guess this is just another way of solving it! :D
